items.name: The Open Knowledge Base - Netherlands workshop
items.contribution: Participant of the workshop
items.description: The aim of the hackathon/workshop is to create a proof of concept of an open knowledge base (OKB) for universities and other research institutions, with a particular focus on two use cases: (1) supporting new approaches to recognizing and rewarding researchers; (2) supporting monitoring of the adoption of open science practices.

items.name: FORCE2019 - the Future Of Research Communications and e-Scholarships
items.contribution: Presenting: 'COCI, the OpenCitations Index of Crossref open DOI-to-DOI citations', and joining the panel: 'Citations: how open do we want them?'
items.description: The FORCE11 annual conference is a different kind of meeting, where stakeholders come together – or scrummage – for an open discussion, on an even playing field, to talk about changing the ways scholarly and scientific information is communicated, shared and used. Researchers, publishers, librarians, computer scientists, informaticians, funders, educators, citizens, and others attend the FORCE11 meeting with a view to supporting the realisation of promising new ideas and identifying new potential collaborators.

items.name: ISSI 2019 - 17th international conference on  scientometrics & informetrics
items.contribution: Hosting the 'Workshop on Open Citations: Opportunities and Ongoing Developments' and presenting OpenCitations and its API service, along with the participation into the ISSI doctoral forum.
items.description: The ISSI 2019 Conference will provide an international forum for scientists, research managers and administrators, as well as information and communication related professionals to share research and debate the advancements of informetric and scientometric theory and applications.

items.name: ISWS 2019 - International Semantic Web Research Summer School
items.contribution: Presenting a poster and attending as a Student of the Summer School
items.description: ISWS is a full immersion, super intensive one-week experience including lectures and keynotes from outstanding speakers, a -learning by doing- teamwork program on open research problems, under the guidance of the best scientists in the field, with whom you will co-author a white paper of high potential impact

items.name: EURAM 2019

items.name: WikiCite 2018
items.contribution: Presenting a talk about: OSCAR and LUCINDA with Wikidata
items.description: WikiCite 2018 is a 3-day conference, summit, and hack day dedicated to the vision of creating an open repository of bibliographic data to support the citation and fact-checking needs of Wikimedia related_tos, and possibly, to serve as an open infrastructure for research, education, and information quality across the web.

items.name: Workshop on Open Citations
items.contribution: Member of workshop staff
items.description: About 500 million open bibliographic citations are available on the web. We invite to this workshop researchers, scholarly publishers, funders, policy makers, and opening citations advocates, interested in the widespread adoption of practises for creation, reuse and improvement of open citation data.

items.name: The Web Conference
items.contribution: Presenting OSCAR at the SAVE-SD workshop
items.description: The Web Conference (formerly www conference) is a yearly international conference on the topic of the future directions of the World Wide Web. The main goal of this workshop I have attended, is bringing together publishers, companies and researchers from different fields (including Document and Knowledge Engineering, Semantic Web, Natural Language Processing, Scholarly Communication, Bibliometrics, and Human-Computer Interaction) in order to bridge the gap between the theoretical/academic and practical/industrial aspects with regards to scholarly data.
